reviews.review_msg: weekly tests that you HAD to be there for based on the weekly readings. students who came to lectures were definitely rewarded (through quizzes and bonus assignments where if you were in class you were guaranteed the marks). Chelsey was very approachable and really cared for each students success. lots of reading.

Boring class, might've been more engaged if the professor for INDG 101 was Indigenous but she can't control that. Lectures were very preachy without much critical thinking or useful ideas. 3 hour long lectures with one 10 min break. Plenty of homework from readings, podcast reviews, etc. At least she was an easy grader.

Professor Armstrong is very organized, each week you can see what needs to be done and there are weekly quizzes done in lecture worth 45% of your grade. The quizzes are based on the two readings done each week and some lecture material. Although it's a three hour lecture, she makes it very engaging and gives us breaks throughout the lecture.

Ms Armstrong is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about her subject. Unfortunately I wasn't however her 3 hour lectures were still fun because of her personality and style of teaching. The tests were somewhat hard but fair and my main issue is with the sheer amount of reading she assigns (more than my literature class).

The most boring and long lectures of my life. Chelsea is a nice person and passionate about her job which I admire a lot, however, is a tough grader and unclear in some of her guidelines, especially for the final paper. The course content was interesting, yet readings boring and hard to read.

Her lectures were always super engaging and we often got to get let out a little early from our 3 hour class. There were weekly quizzes based on the readings but they were pretty easy if you've read them. She's definitely my favourite prof so far and I'd highly recommend taking a course with her if you get the chance!
